section.p: Most of the data types are self explanatory and are adapted to the database in use. Refer to the database documentation for its data types specifics.
The following sections document data types within dbUnit.

Blobs contain binary data. DbUnit, however, processes data with XML or CSV files containing textual data sets, not binary. To push binary data into a database blob from dbUnit data set files, use the following syntax in a data set field:
The table below shows how to use each of the forms available to load binary data into a blob.

tr.td:
Insert text in a blob. By default the encoding used is UTF-8, but optionally any encoding can be provided.
Example with UTF-8 encoding:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[TEXT]This is my text, saved in UTF-8 (default) encoding. Java: bon café!" COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>
Example with ISO-8859-1 encoding:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[TEXT ISO-8859-1]This is my text, saved in ISO-8859-1 encoding. Java: bon café!" COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>

Insert binary in a blob using Base64
Example:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[BASE64]VGhpcyBpcyBteSB0ZXh0Lg==" COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>

Insert the content of a binary file in a blob.
Example:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[FILE /path/to/file/to/download]Following text here is being ignored." COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>

Insert the content pointed by a URL in a blob.
Example:
<!DOCTYPE dataset SYSTEM "my-dataset.dtd"> <dataset> <TABLE_WITHBLOB COL0="[URL http://path/to/url]Following text here is being ignored." COL1="row 0 col 1" COL2="row 0 col 2"/> </dataset>
